content.description:
Boulder a slopey move to get on the brown slab.  Wander up and clip the first bolt on the gorgeous head wall.  Tricky but easy (5.11) climbing off the slab leads up a pretty dihedral.

Rest up at the top of the corner, then funk out of the dihedral onto the powerful face.  Pull crux moves to get to the horizontal.  Take a quick shake and then yard through the last tenuous moves to hit the anchors.
content.location:
Immediately to the right of the new

Totem Pole

on the lower wall of The Road Cut.

content.description:
DUE TO ROCKFALL, this route is GONE.

EDIT: Rejoice, the Totem Pile has been restored!

This route was for many years a very scary lead with huge runouts and loose terrain. Then someone cleaned it up and bolted it. Then half the route fell off. Then it got a handful of new bolts and is now much shorter. The grade probably stayed about the same.

Unless you have a massive wingspan, you'll have to go left to pass bolt 6. The small ledge above is currently covered with kitty litter and small rocks, try not to pelt your belayer. Not a great route but maybe worthwhile if you need a warm-up...
content.location:
The route is just to the left of

Transmogrifier

on the obvious arete.

content.description:
Kinda like Transmog but a bit harder is the consensus...have watched a couple people do it, looks like a monodoight crux...

Marc Lemenestral nearly onsighted after utterly hiking Penguin Lust and Transmog...
content.location:
Just right of

Transmogrifier

on the overhanging lower buttress of the roadcut...

content.description: Located between Crack A No Go and the sport climb Big Shot.  This curved finger crack splits the a near-verical face after an overhanging bouldery start.For some reason its not mentioned at all in Carville's book despite the fact that it's pretty hard to miss.
content.protection:
Pro to one inch, shares top anchors with

Crack  A No Go

.

content.description:
Incredible "main" face of the Roadcut.

Killer technical pocket climbing.  Sustained and thin.  There are a couple of cruxes low; you'll need your footwork dialed to send them...

Save some juice for the top...rockfall may have made this a bit harder.
content.location: The "you just can't miss it" orange face.  Starts off the highest ledge system at Roadcut.
Furthest bolt line on the wall facing the road, shares start with Far Side (12d) but splits left after the second bolt. Lower off.

content.description:
Start by climbing into the pod.   At the first bolt move out left onto the face, and make a hard move to gain the good right slanting rail and the second bolt.   Climb up to the ledge and wander over to the wall and clip the 3rd bolt.

Move back slightly right and up to good hollow sounding holds.   Continue up to a good resting point below the crux.

The crux involves rocking over onto a high mantle for the left foot and a reach to a bomber flake.   Continue up the flake to the anchors.

content.location:
This is the corner just to the right of Hit and Run and Penguin Lust and to the left of

Totem Pole

.

content.description: The furthest left climb on the road cut, Escargot climbs up a pocketed face facing north, then after reaching a ledge, you climb up an east facing face with fewer features.
content.protection: 6 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor, use a sling on the 3rd bolt to reduce rope drag.  Carville's book doesn't mention the first 3 bolts, but they're there.You could probably use cam placements in the numerous pockets to protect yourself as well.

content.description: This route is in the Falcon Guide series "Rock Climbing Lake Tahoe" by Mike Carville 1999 Which rates the route 10c if I am looking correctly. The route is more like 11c.
content.protection: It has approximately 7 bolts plus anchors

content.description: Climb the large dihedral and crack about 2 feet to the right of it up a block on the left side of the road cut. A brief period where the crack is too wide for fist jams is the crux.
content.protection: Pro to 4 inches, there's a smaller crack within the main one making most any sized gear usefull.There are two bolts atop the ledge for rappelling off, but they don't work so well to top rope from unless you use a long sling.
